summary: Experienced Allocation Manager with a demonstrated history of working in the consumer electronics industry. Skilled in Warehouse Operations, Management, Continuous Improvement, Logistics Management, and Automotive. Strong support professional with a Bachelor's degree focused in Business Administration, Management and Operations from TSM Business School.

profile_positions.title: Supply & Inventory Manager High Temperature Sensors

profile_positions.description: In 2016, Sensata Technologies started a global analysis on their complete product portfolio. Each region was assigned a person that had to analyze where we had products that we do not sell at a sustainable margin and why, and if we could do something about this. It is my job to work with the marketers and the Key Account managers to determine if we can do better and how. This can result in a price increase, but it can also be that Sensata just has to do better in their manufacturing to cut costs there. It can also be that an item needs to be discontinued, or replaced by a similar item. This job requires a lot of patience, affinity with numbers and data mining.
profile_positions.title: Pricing Manager

profile_positions.description: In 2016 a new team was formed within Sensata, the Growth Team. Within Sensata, we get about 200 NBO requests on a yearly basis, a so called New Business Opportunity. Our customers ask us to quote a products for a certain volume/platform/timeframe/specs. To be able to do that, we have to build a business case in which we calculate how we can approach this the best, at which costs and for which margin, to make sure that we win the business but also make a profit. This process was not streamlined and scattered and put a heavy burden on the organization, as it always needed to be done in a limited time frame. The Growth Team was created to streamline this whole process and to centralize the building of the business cases in one team, and be the team in the organization that used the knowledge of the other departments in the organization without letting each and every part of that organization do a small part of the business case. The Growth Team members have a lot of interaction with Marketing, Sales, PMT, Finance, Manufacturing, Process, Purchasing, Customer Service to make sure that the business case built in feasible, accurate, profitable and accepted by our customers as well as our own internal organization.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager Growth Team New Business

profile_positions.description: Supporting the Key Account Manager in building business cases, solving price issues, streamline sample requests to alleviate the administrative burden from the Key Account Manager. Visit customers to discuss issues they see and working internally with other departments to solve these issues for the customer.
profile_positions.title: Account Support Manager

profile_positions.description: Sensata purchased a complete fully automated manufacturing line for the CTS sensor from BorgWarner Beru. (Closed Temperature Sensor). This manufacturing line had to be moved to our manufacturing facilities in Botevgrad, Bulgaria, and at the same time we where obliged to maximize output to enable transfer stock build for our main customers, so they could be supplied while the line was moved. Furthermore, we knew that our customer demand would be going up and new part numbers were to be released, which complicated the project. I was assigned to stabilize and streamline the productionplanning in cooperation with the people in Borgwarner Ludwigsburg, and to allocate the capacity we had in such a way that we had minimum change over time between products, minimum downtime and maximum output, to supply the customers but also to build the necessary transfer stock. In parallel we started up a new, semi-automated production line which made the same product, in Botevgrad and as a consequence we also had for all customers a phase over planning from the Germany-produced products to the Bulgaria-produced products. For that I was also made responsible to plan the production in Botevgrad in such a way that we would have minimal obsolete stock from German products and a smooth phase-over to Bulgarian products.  Together with a small team we had daily calls with several large OEM's about output, shipments, stockbuild and phase over planning. After approximately a year we were able to transfer the German line without any major issues in customer supply.
profile_positions.title: Bottleneck & Delivery Crisis Manager CTS Integration

profile_positions.description:
Due to the implementation of an upgraded ERP system (Oracle R12), I have been assigned as Subject Matter Expert for Europe in the field of Order Management, and Supporting Subject Matter Expert for Demand Planning.
This job consists of: understanding business requirements, understanding the business processes needed for these requirements, writing procedures, writing training material for +/- 250 people worlwide for this new ERP system in my functional are, working with a global team to align regional requirements & processes (Mexico, Brasil, Dominican Republic, United States, Netherlands, Bulgaria, Singapore, China, Malaysia, Korea, Japan) in such a way that processes & workinstructions are standardized in stead of customized. Making sure that current production environment of Oracle is cleaned for conversion, so that only accurate data is tranferred to the new instance. Therefore I have travelled regurlarly to the USA to work with my other team members in meetings to discuss the requirements, to test multiple scenarios in a test environment to detect flaws & problems, to fix these and to prepare for training and Go-Live.
profile_positions.title: Subject Matter Expert

profile_positions.description: In 2012 the Order Management Department was relocated from Almelo to Sofia due to an acquisition. Since the beginning I have been involved in training the new employees in the day-to-day business of an Order Fulfillment employee, by travelling every other week to Sofia in Bulgaria. This consisted of: managing customer orders in a correct and timely matter; managing stocks, managing orders from the production locations to ensure an on time delivery towards the customers; understanding the supply chain of Sensata, understanding the demands and requirements of the Automotive Business; managing customer returns & quality complaints; ensuring deliveries under every circumstance to ensure customer production is not endangered; communicating with the distribution centre to ensure deliveries; performing correct & accurate communication with the customers.
profile_positions.title: Order Management Specialist, Trainer

profile_positions.description: Responsible for the regional coordination of demand management including, line load and inventory management for the APT (Automotive Pressure Transducer). This includes inventory modelling & managing, offload planning from one make site to the other (Mexico vs China), leading allocations regionally & worldwide in case of capacity & delivery constraints. Monitoring backlog fluctuations, fill rate, forecast accuracy. Cooperating with marketing to ensure correct forecast in correct organization, to ensure optimal use of production capacity and respecting customer demand.
profile_positions.title: Regional Demand Planning Manager Sensor Products

profile_positions.description:
Managing customer orders, line loads, inventory levels, delivery plans, consignment deliveries & inventories, allocations in tight supply chains. Perform physical counts at consignment warehouses, visited customers to discuss delivery and change management plans, lead and overlook global phase in-phase -out programs for cost reductions or quality improvements.

During this position, I also participated in the integration of 2 acquisitions, namely First Technologies and Honeywell, both Automotive Suppliers.
profile_positions.title: Customer Service Rep.
